data.title: BQ Aquaris E4.5 & E5 Smartphones with Ubuntu OS Launched in India

data.text:
Spanish smartphone BQ has launched the first Ubuntu-powered smartphonesÂ in India. The device ‘Aquaris E4.5’ and ‘Aquaris E5‘ will be exclusively available through Snapdeal andÂ priced at Rs.11,999 and Rs. 13,499 respectively.Â The Ubunutu OS that is coming in this smartphone, will be based on Scopes concept, which aggregates content into type-specific screens, unlike the grids of app icons that you have been seeing in almost all the present smartphone operating systems. According to Canonical (the maker of OS), the device will work as a phone until it is connected to a keyboard and monitor, where it starts working like a full-fledged Ubuntu OS for PCs.

These are same devices that are launched by the brand earlier this year. The Aquaris E4.5 comes with a 4.5-inch qHD (540Ã960) IPS display with a pixel density of 240ppi. It is powered by a 1.3GHz MediaTek quad-core processor and 1GB of RAM. This dual SIM device comes with 8GB of internal storage out of which only 5.5GB will be available to the end user, the company also provides a microSD card for storage expansion up to 32GB.

It sports an 8MP rear camera with dual LED flash that can record videos at Full HD resolution and a 5MP front camera. The device comes with a battery of 2,150mAh battery and offers connectivity features like 3G, Wi-Fi, GPS/A-GPS, Bluetooth 4.0 and Â MicroUSB port.Â The device measures 137 x 67 x 9 mm and weighs 123 grams.

Talking about the Aquaris E5, it comes with a 5-inch HD (1280×720) IPS display with a Dragontrail glass protection. Under the hood, it is powered by the same 1.3GHz quad-core processor with 1GB of RAM found the Aquaris E4.5. The internal storage is doubled up from 8GB to 16GB on this device, where 13GB will be available to the end user. It also comes with a microSD card Â slot for storage expansion up to 32GB.

There is a 13MP rear with an aperture of f/2.2 andÂ dual LED flash, on the front it has the same 5MP camera with an aperture of f/2.4. he device is powered by a Li-Po 2,500mAh battery. Connectivity on this device includes Wi-Fi, 3G, GPA/A-GPS, Bluetooth 4.0 and microUSB port.
